page.title: 02SALISBURY PLAIN PATHWAYS
page.content: There are many footpaths and tracks around this area, though some of them are restricted to the public whilst the army exercises and target practice on the firing ranges are in progress. This is normally indicated by red and yellow flags, which prohibits any unauthorised person to pass them whilst they are flying. Sometimes these training areas are inhabited by thousands of servicemen taking part in exercises, with tanks, guns and other military hardware, and the 'press' even dares to suggest that {'Cruse Missiles'}have been tested in the vicinity! On days when the flags are down it is worth exploring some of the 'Rights of Way' to see the many different plants that thrive, but of course, one must always be on guard for unexp- loded ammunition which has strayed.
